comment.author: 45618415@N05
comment._content:
Nope, definitely not Dingle.

The church is wrong (I'm one of the priests based there) and the buildings don't look familiar. The church in Dingle (built 1864) has a distinctive tower.

comment._content: Schull? No, probably not. That's a pretty big pier, there, with a steamer tied up at it.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: I didn't say this earlier (don't give out to me!), as our catalogue has proved wrong before with the O'Connor photos, but this might be Berehaven. What do ye think?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 45618415@N05
comment._content: I don't know Castletownbere(haven) well enough to say for certain. The church visible in the photo is NOT the current Church of the Sacred Heart, Castletownbere, but that only dates from about 1910. I suppose it MIGHT be the previous church: www.westcork.org/coppermine2/displayimage.php?album=19&am... The mountains behind the town seem consistent with Castletownbere. That big building just left of centre in the photograph should be a good clue for someone who knows the area.

comment.author: 45618415@N05
comment._content: I'll also add a link to this sketch of the pier in Castletownbere which was drawn in the late 1800s. www.bhs.ie/heritage/displayimage.php?album=3&pid=104#... I think the church matches, at least...

comment.author: 41675580@N08
comment._content:
What a lovely old picture, that must be one very well trained horse.
Or they have filled it up with Irish whisky!
No, that could'nt be right, or it would have fallen overboard.

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: 100% Sure this is Castletown Berehaven. 1. Look at this pair of buildings which are in clear view if you zoom into the photo Street View 1

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: 2. Again these buildings can be clearly seen on the zoom Street View 2 The Church of the Sacred Heart (See Street View 2) was built in 1912 on the site of an earlier chapel, which helps date our photo as it was before this date.

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: 3. This House is a 100% match Street View 3

comment.author: 52797433@N06
comment._content: Here's a street view taken from across the harbour. You can see the line of the mountains matches perfectly with your picture : maps.google.ie/maps?q=Castletownbere&hl=en&ll=51....

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/denisecarroll] This is the view from Dinish Island maps.google.ie/maps?q=Castletownbere&hl=en&ll=51.... Here it is on historic OSI maps maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,468216,545758,6,9

comment.author: 45618415@N05
comment._content: I'm wondering whether the large building to the left of the church is the then Mercy Convent school.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: I'm sure you are right, [http://www.flickr.com/photos/bernardhealy], and that is the Mercy convent school, since replaced by this (in Streetview).

comment.author: 14302637@N08

There are also other historic maps for the North of Ireland. maps.osni.gov.uk/mapconsolehistoricalmaps.aspx and maps.ehsni.gov.uk/SixInchSeries/Default.aspx You can add your own photos to the Google maps within Flickr. Just click on "Actions". From old Pete in Blackpool, Lancs.

comment.author: 77318933@N08

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/tj_q8]  Hi T. J. 

The Church of the Sacred Heart (See Street View 2) was built in 1912 on the site of an earlier chapel, which helps date our photo as it was before this date.

comment.author: 79577558@N00
comment._content: This is Castletownbere, Co. Cork. I can see Castle House and the houses of Blackrock Terrace, which are all still around today.
